column1: Doral is a city in Miami-Dade County
column3: United States. One of 34 municipalities in the county
column4: it is one mile (1.6 km) from Miami International Airport and 13 miles (21 km) from Downtown Miami. The city regularly hosts more than 100
column5: 000 people who work in Miami. Doral occupies 15 square miles (39 km2) bordered on the west by the Ronald Reagan Turnpike
column6: on the north by the Town of Medley
column7: on the east by the Palmetto Expressway and on the south by the City of Sweetwater. It is a principal city of the Miami metropolitan area

column1: Doral has operated under the mayor-council-manager form of government since incorporation. Policymaking and legislative authority are vested in a governing council consisting of the mayor and four other councilmembers. The council
column3: is responsible for passing ordinances and resolutions
column6: city clerk and city attorney. The city manager is responsible for carrying out the council's policies and ordinances
column8: and appointing the heads of various departments.

column2: residents began lobbying for incorporation in earnest
column3: dissatisfied with the high tax rate relative to the services they received
column4: as well as unchecked growth. The county met the first attempt at incorporation with a year's deferral. Some classified Doral as a "donor community
column5: meaning that the taxes paid were more than the cost of operations. With the deferral, incorporation efforts intensified even more. In 1996, the community elected its first community council: Jose Pepe" Cancio
column7: Mario Pita and Barbara B. Thomas were elected and three other members were appointed. The council initially met once every month.In 2002
column8: Governor Jeb Bush appointed Cancio to fill the remainder of Miami-Dade Commissioner Miriam Alonso's term of office. Doral residents hoped that his appointment would bring the community closer to incorporation
column9: and their hopes were realized. Although Cancio endorsed Juan Carlos Bermudez

column3: 85% of Doral's voters voted in favor of incorporation. In June of the same year
column4: 92% voted to accept the City Charter and elected their first Mayor and City Council.

column1: The new City of Doral was named as an attractive location for entrepreneurs with an interest in the Latin America market. Mayor Luigi Boria
column3: became the second Venezuelan-American mayor in the United States. He was replaced by Juan Carlos Bermudez who won a reelection bid in 2016.

column1: The Miami-Dade Police Department's headquarters and Midwest District Station are in Doral. The Miami-Dade Fire Rescue Department's headquarters is in Doral.

The Florida Department of Law Enforcement operates the Miami Regional Operations Center in an unincorporated area that was formerly a part of the Doral CDP and is outside Doral's city limits.The National Transportation Safety Board operates the Miami Aviation Field Office in Doral.The United States Postal Service operates the Doral Branch Post Office in Doral.
The City of Doral Trolley was launched on February 1
column2: 2008 and has been available to residents and visitors alike for a convenient free ride. The pilot program involved a weekday route that ran from 7:00 am to 7:00 pm with one trolley servicing one route. Since then
column3: the City has added five new trolleys and has expanded service with two additional routes
column4: one of which connects to the Metrorail. Currently the system has three routes serviced by seven trolleys.

column1: The City of Doral operates and maintains eight parks with an abundance of amenities for every age and lifestyle.
Doral is a part of the Miami-Dade County Public Schools system.
Residents are zoned to the following education facilities:Public schools (MDCPS)
Ronald W. Reagan/Doral Senior High School
Renaissance Elementary and Middle Charter School
Just Arts and Management Charter Middle School
Joy of Learning Child Care Center
